headline: Why The Narrative Around Wells Fargo Is Shifting With Fee Strength And Higher Return Targets
summary: Wells Fargo's fair value estimate has nudged up to $94.50 from $93.71 as analysts grow more confident that stronger fee income and capital returns can support a higher long term intrinsic value, even as revenue growth expectations ease slightly to a more conservative 6.94% from 7.01%. At the same time, a modest reduction in the discount rate to 8.19% from 8.21% reflects a slightly lower perceived risk profile, tied to improving returns on tangible common equity and clearer medium term...

headline: Truist Rewards Shareholders With New $10B Share Repurchase Plan
summary: TFC announces a new $10B share buyback, replacing its prior plan. This signals continued capital returns alongside steady dividend payouts.

headline: Robinhood: Analyst sees a credible case for upside
summary: Investing.com -- Truist initiated coverage of Robinhood Markets at Buy in a note on Wednesday, saying the trading platform’s product expansion and scale economics position it for sustained growth and margin expansion as it moves upmarket.

headline: Profits, the Fed, and where sector leadership goes next
summary: You can catch Trader Talk on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, YouTube, or wherever you get your podcasts. Investors who can stay patient may have the real edge heading into 2026. On Trader Talk, Kenny Polcari sits down with Truist (TFC) Chief Investment Officer and Chief Market Strategist Keith Lerner to break down what surprised him most in 2025 and why resilient corporate profits kept this bull market alive. Lerner outlines a “weight of the evidence” outlook for 2026, encompassing the labor market, Fed rate-cut expectations, and where sector leadership may persist beyond the AI trade. Watch more episodes of Trader Talk here. Trader Talk with Kenny Polcari on Yahoo Finance delivers expert analysis and actionable insights, empowering you to navigate market volatility and secure your financial future. This post was written by Langston Sessoms.

headline: Why Analysts See Kymera Therapeutics Differently After KT 621 Momentum And Rising Fair Value
summary: Kymera Therapeutics has seen a sharp reset in long term expectations, with the fair value estimate jumping from $77.59 to $114.00 even as modeled revenue growth is revised down from roughly -0.04% to -4.42%. This seemingly contradictory mix, stronger upside but more conservative top line assumptions, reflects rising Street conviction in KT-621’s ultimate commercial potential and probability of success, offset by a more cautious stance on how quickly that opportunity will materialize. Stay...
